dt: {bc}a valved brass instrument resembling a trumpet in design and range but having a shorter partly conical tube and less brilliant tone
{bc}something shaped like a cone: such as
{bc}a piece of paper twisted for use as a container
{bc}a cone-shaped pastry shell that is often filled with whipped cream

et: Middle English {it}cornet, cornette{/it} "six-holed wooden wind instrument" (now usually {it}cornett{/it} or {it}cornetto{/it}), borrowed from Middle French {it}cornet,{/it} from {it}corn{/it} "horn" (going back to Old French, going back to Latin {it}cornum, cornū{/it}) + {it}-et{/it} {et_link|-et:1|-et:1} {ma}{mat|horn|}{/ma}
shortdef: a valved brass instrument resembling a trumpet in design and range but having a shorter partly conical tube and less brilliant tone
something shaped like a cone: such as
a piece of paper twisted for use as a container

dt: {bc}the onetime fifth grade of commissioned officer in a British cavalry troop who carried the standard
{bc}the onetime lowest commissioned rank in the U.S. cavalry

et: borrowed from Middle French {it}cornette{/it} "lappet terminating a woman's headdress, pennon, standard of a troop, officer holding the standard," from {it}corne{/it} "horn, wimple with horn-like appendages," going back to Latin {it}cornua,{/it} plural (taken as singular) of {it}cornū{/it} "horn" {ma}{mat|horn|}{/ma}
shortdef: the standard of a cavalry troop
the onetime fifth grade of commissioned officer in a British cavalry troop who carried the standard
the onetime lowest commissioned rank in the U.S. cavalry
